isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - TACH-N-TIME DYNAMIC TIMING METER (ZTSE-4142)

svcsubproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcsubproc.para: The ZTSE-4142 TACH-N-TIME uses the latest in microprocessor technology to quickly and accurately measure fuel injection pump timing.
The pump pulse is picked up by a clamp on pick-up which fastens to the engine mounted line pressure sensor on the No. 4 injection nozzle.
Crankshaft location is picked up with a magnetic probe. The probe offset is automatically computed by the ZTSE-4142 TACH-N-TIME at 20° offset.
Using the pump pulse signal and the crankshaft location signal, a microprocessor gives a digital display of exact engine RPM and injection pump timing in degrees.

step1.para: Select the clamp on pick-up (ZTSE-4142-73) for the line pressure sensor.
Attach the "alligator style" pick-up (ZTSE-4142-73) to the line pressure sensor on the No. 4 injection nozzle.

important.para: SLIDE THE PROTECTIVE CAP OFF THE LINE PRESSURE SENSOR PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE PICK-UP. REFER TO FIGURE 4.5.

step1.para: Connect ground clamp from pick-up clamp harness to an appropriate ground as shown in Figure 4.5.
Connect the remaining wire from the pick-up clamp harness to the plug in receptacle on the ZTSE-4142 body labeled "SENSOR SIGNAL".

important.para: LINE PRESSURE SENSOR AND PICK-UP CLAMP MUST BE DRY. WET CONDITIONS CAN CAUSE ERRATIC READINGS. IF ERRATIC READINGS ARE OBSERVED, REMOVE THE PICK-UP CLAMP AND DRY THE CLAMP AND LINE PRESSURE SENSOR WITH A CLEAN, DRY CLOTH. SPRAY THE PICK-UP CLAMP AND LINE PRESSURE SENSOR ON ALL SURFACES WITH A WATER DISPLACING SUBSTANCE SUCH AS WD-40 AND RECLAMP THE PICK-UP TO THE LINE PRESSURE SENSOR.

step1.para: Set "SENSOR SIGNAL" toggle switch to the "CLAMP ON" position.
7.3 Liter Diesel uses magnetic probe method for determining crankshaft position.
Insert the magnetic probe into the magnetic pick-up access hole located on engine. (See Figure 4.2).
Plug probe terminal into the receptacle on the ZTSE-4142 body labeled "MAGNETIC PICK-UP".
Set toggle switch to "MAGNETIC PICK-UP" position.
Connect the ZTSE-4142 battery leads to the vehicle battery (red to "+", black to "-"). Display should light up and read Set...20.0).

caution.para: DO NOT CONNECT TO BATTERY SYSTEM WITH A "FLOATING GROUND". THE ZTSE-4142 SHOULD BE POWERED FROM A SOURCE WITH A FIXED GROUND.

step1.para: The meter automatically reads 20° timing offset. No presetting or adjustment is required for the 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine.
Make sure all cables and wires are clear of fan, belts or any other moving parts. Keep wires away from exhaust manifolds.
Start engine. Sensor light on ZTSE-4142 should be blinking regularly, indicating proper function of connectors. Allow engine to reach operating temperature.
Check initial dynamic timing with the Housing Pressure Cold Advance (HPCA) Solenoid disconnected from the HPCA terminal. Run the engine at 2000 RPM, no load, and record dynamic timing.
Reconnect the HPCA Solenoid terminal and apply battery voltage using a jumper wire to activate the HPCA Solenoid. Run the engine at 2000 RPM, no load, and record the timing. Refer to Figure 4.3.
Calculate the degrees of advance by subtracting the initial timing recorded in Step 8 from the advance timing recorded in Step 9. The difference equals the degrees of advance.

note.para: Timing Advance should be 2° (minimum) above initial timing. Engine RPM and timing angle can be read directly from the ZTSE-4142 display.

figure.caption: Figure 4.6 Activating HPCA Using a Jumper Wire

step1.para: After timing operation is complete, reinstall the plastic line pressure sensor cap.
